titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yale-New Haven Hospital Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Manuscripts and Archives Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:31

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of the administrative records of the Yale-New Haven Hospital from the office of the Executive Director. A large part of the records are from the office of Albert W. Snoke who was executive Director from 1946-1968. The records cover the history of the hospital as a whole and its individual departments, its relations with Yale University, the city of New Haven, the state of Connecticut, and general issues such as health care delivery, voluntary health organizations, internships, family planning, and establishment of regional programs. Included are correspondence, oral histories, reports, clippings, memoranda, minutes of meetings, legal and financial records, and speeches. These papers form part of the Contemporary Medical Care and Health Policy Collection.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Yale-New Haven Hospital Records (MS 835). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Albert Snoke Papers (Papers of the Executive Director, Yale-New Haven Hospital) Received from Albert Snoke, 7/20/1978; transferred fom the Yale University Medical Library, 1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of the administrative records of the Yale-New Haven Hospital from the office of the Executive Director. A large part of the records are from the office of Albert W. Snoke who was executive Director from 1946-1968. The records cover the history of the hospital as a whole and its individual departments, its relations with Yale University, the city of New Haven, the state of Connecticut, and general issues such as health care delivery, voluntary health organizations, internships, family planning, and establishment of regional programs. Included are correspondence, oral histories, reports, clippings, memoranda, minutes of meetings, legal and financial records, and speeches.

Any of the files may contain correspondence, minutes of meetings, memoranda, reports, program outlines, and notes. In some places it appears that Snoke has also added materials from his personal files. (Materials dated after ca. 1967 could not have been created by Snoke as the hospital's executive director.) Snoke has apparently made a very careful selection from the files that were stored at the hospital and has included here only those files which will document what he considered to be the important issues or developments in health care during his tenure. Snoke has arranged these selected files according to a topical scheme. The files are now grouped under seven general headings: Hospital Activities and History; Hospital Departments; Yale University, which I understand as meaning the relationship between the hospital and the University; City of New Haven, which concerns the hospital's relationship to city government; State of Connecticut, which includes materials on coordinating the development of health care facilities statewide and dealings with the state government; National, which deals with some issues involving the federal government but also covers national medical organizations; and Miscellaneous. Material on any particular subject can be found under more than one heading.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.p: A preliminary report providing the architectural program and preliminary design for expansion of the Yale-New Haven Medical Center over several decades.

odd.p: This material was created prior to Snoke, perhaps by James A. Hamilton.

odd.p: Most of this material was created prior to Snoke. It includes some early leaflets which are quite interesting.

odd.p: Original folder marked "Confidential." Brody, a hospital neurosurgeon, now deceased, was under the care of a psychiatrist.

odd.head: General
odd.p: Original folder marked "Confidential." Concerned with the references for ERW before hiring by Yale. There were accusations about his politics.

odd.head: General
